conclusion: Analyze forces on hemispheres A and B to determine friction coefficient.
Hemisphere B has mass 2m and is smooth; Hemisphere A has mass m and friction with left wall.
Vertical force on B due to gravity is 2mg; Force F exerted by A on B at 30° angle.
Resolve force F on B into horizontal and vertical components.
F cos(30°) is the normal force from A; F sin(30°) equals 2mg.
Calculate normal force F_N on A: F_N = 2√3mg.
Forces on A: Vertical force mg, normal force F_N, and frictional force F_f.
Vertical equilibrium for A: F_f + mg = F_N1.
Final answer: Dynamic friction factor is √3/3.
